Nagarajan, Naveen (Cognizant) wrote:

> Hi,
>         Thanks a lot for your answer.
>         For query A,actually ,I will be doing the checking many times in 
> similar test classes.
>         Can you suggest something which can address the issue ?

Yes. The book Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code, by 
Martin Fowler. It will teach you how to remove duplication in code.

>         Also,as i said,the data becomes invalid with time and also i 
> need  to build the entire Hashtable (expected value) object.
>         Is there any other way around for this ?

Why does the data become invalid with time? Can you write your tests in 
a way that the data never becomes invalid with time? Can you "stop time" 
in your tests?

>         Is there any simpler way for building the Hashtable object or 
> making the test data for the expected Object consistent with the DB.

It depends on why the data becomes invalid with time.
